parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.description: Project endpoint in the form of: https://<aiservices-id>.services.ai.azure.com/projects/<project-name>

get.description: Lists all Agents, returning an array of Agent objects.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.description: Creates a new Agent resource and returns it.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

parameters.name: agentId
parameters.description: The ID of the Agent to retrieve.

put.description: Updates or replaces an agent and returns the updated resource.

parameters.name: agentId
parameters.description: The ID of the Agent to update.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The updated Agent data.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

delete.description: Deletes an Agent by its ID, returning 204 on success.

parameters.name: agentId
parameters.description: The ID of the Agent to delete.

204.description: There is no content to send for this request, but the headers may be useful.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.description: Requests a completion for a specific Agent, returning an AgentCompletion.

parameters.name: agentId
parameters.description: The ID of the Agent for which to request a completion.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The parameters used to generate a completion for this agent.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.description: Requests a streaming completion for a specific Agent, returning a stream of updates.

parameters.name: agentId
parameters.description: The ID of the Agent for which to request a streaming completion.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Parameters controlling how the agent's streaming completion is generated.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.description:
Requests a completion for the entire “Agents” collection,
using CompleteParams as input and returning an AgentCompletion.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.description:
Requests a streaming completion for the entire “Agents” collection,
returning a stream of StreamingAgentCompletionUpdate items.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

get.description: List all versions of the given DatasetVersion

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the resource

parameters.name: $orderBy
parameters.description: Please choose OrderBy value from ['createdtime', 'modifiedtime']

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Top count of results, top count cannot be greater than the page size. If topCount > page size, results with be default page size count will be returned

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Continuation token for pagination.

parameters.name: $tags
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of tag names (and optionally values). Example: tag1,tag2=value2

parameters.name: listViewType
parameters.description: [ListViewType.ActiveOnly, ListViewType.ArchivedOnly, ListViewType.All] View type for including/excluding (for example) archived entities.

parameters.description: The definition of the DatasetVersion to create

Repeatability-Result.description: Indicates whether the repeatable request was accepted or rejected.

values.name: accepted
values.description: If the request was accepted and the server guarantees that the server state reflects a single execution of the operation.

values.name: rejected
values.description:
If the request was rejected because the combination of Repeatability-First-Sent and Repeatability-Request-ID were invalid
or because the Repeatability-First-Sent value was outside the range of values held by the server.

Agents.AIContent.description: An abstract representation of a structured content item within a chat message.

Agents.Agent.description: Represents an AI agent with configuration, instructions, and tool access.

agentId.description: A unique identifier for the agent.

description.description: A description of the agent; used for display purposes and to describe the agent.

metadata.description: Arbitrary metadata associated with this agent.

name.description: The name of the agent; used for display purposes and sent to the LLM to identify the agent.

agentModel.description: The model definition for this agent.

instructions.description: Instructions provided to guide how this agent operates.

tools.description: A list of tool definitions available to the agent.

toolChoice.description: How the agent should choose among provided tools.

Agents.AgentCompleteParams.description: Parameters for creating a new completion with agent overrides.

overrides.description: The overrides for the agent responsible for generating the completion.

input.description: The list of input messages for the completion.

threadId.description: Optional identifier for an existing conversation thread.

metadata.description: Optional metadata associated with the completion request.

userId.description: Identifier for the user making the request.

store.description: Flag indicating whether to store the completion and associated messages.

Agents.AgentCompletion.description: An agent-generated completion record, including messages and status.

agentId.description: Unique identifier for the agent responsible for the completion.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the completion was initiated (Unix time).

completedAt.description: Timestamp when the completion finished processing (Unix time).

status.description: Final status of the completion request.

output.description: List of output messages generated by the agent.

threadId.description: Identifier for the thread associated with the completion.

usage.description: Token usage details for this completion.

incompleteDetails.description: Details about why the response is incomplete, if applicable.

reason.description: Reason describing why the response is incomplete.

Agents.AgentMessage.description: An agent message within a chat, always with the 'agent' role.

content.description: The contents of the agent message.

Agents.AgentModel.description: Represents the model or provider-specific data used by the agent.

id.description: A unique model or deployment ID for this agent model.

provider.description: The name of the provider for this model (e.g., 'openai').

endpoint.description: An endpoint where the provider can be reached, if applicable.

Agents.AgentOptions.description: Options used when creating or updating an Agent.

name.description: The name of the agent; used for display purposes and sent to the LLM to identify the agent.

agentModel.description: The model definition for this agent.

instructions.description: Instructions provided to guide how this agent operates.

tools.description: A list of tool definitions available to the agent.

toolChoice.description: How the agent should choose among provided tools.

Agents.AgentToolDefinition.description: Represents a definition of a tool that an agent may use, used in a polymorphic manner.

type.description: Discriminates the various child 'tool definition' types.

options.description: Additional options that specify the behavior of this tool (also polymorphic).

override.description: A set of overrides for the tool's name, description, or parameters.

name.description: An alternate name for the tool.

description.description: An alternate description for the tool.

parameters.description: An alternate JSON schema for the tool's parameters.

Agents.AgentToolOptions.description: Base type for any agent tool-specific options, used in a polymorphic manner.

type.description: Discriminates the various child 'tool options' types.

Agents.Annotations.description: Annotations applied to parts of the message or content.

ToolCallId.description: The tool call ID associated with the annotation.

jsonPath.description: The JSON path associated with the annotation.

url.description: The URL associated with the annotation.

start.description: The start position of the annotation.

end.description: The end position of the annotation.

Agents.AudioContent.description: A structured chat content item containing an audio reference.

fileName.description: The file name for this binary content.

mimeType.description: The MIME type for this binary content.

uri.description: URI where the binary content can be retrieved.

dataUri.description: Data URI containing the binary content inlined.

data.description: Raw bytes for the binary content.

Agents.AuthorRole.description: Possible roles of the message author.

Agents.AutoToolChoiceBehavior.description: Behavior specifying an automatic choice among the given tools.

toolNames.description: The tool names from which the agent can automatically choose.

Agents.AzureAgentModel.description: A specialized AgentModel for Azure-based providers.

options.description: The provider-specific options for this Azure-based model.

Agents.AzureModelOptions.description: A set of provider-specific configuration and behavior options for Azure-based models.

provider.description: Identifies this model options object as an Azure-based provider.

temperature.description:
The sampling temperature to use that controls the apparent creativity of generated completions.
Higher values will make output more random while lower values will make results more focused
and deterministic.
It is not recommended to modify temperature and topP for the same completions request as the
interaction of these two settings is difficult to predict.

topP.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature called nucleus sampling. This value causes the
model to consider the results of tokens with the provided probability mass. As an example, a
value of 0.15 will cause only the tokens comprising the top 15% of probability mass to be
considered.
It is not recommended to modify temperature and topP for the same completions request as the
interaction of these two settings is difficult to predict.

Agents.BingGroundingToolDefinition.description: A tool definition for Microsoft Bing grounding.

connectionName.description: The name of the Bing grounding connection.

Agents.ChatMessage.description: A base model for representing a chat message.

userId.description: The ID of the user who created the message (if applicable).

agentId.description: The ID of the agent who created the message (if applicable).

messageId.description: A unique identifier for this message.

completionId.description: A unique completion ID, if this message was generated by a completion process.

threadId.description: The thread to which this message belongs.

role.description: The role of this message's author.

authorName.description: An optional display name for the author.

createdAt.description: The timestamp (in Unix time) when this message was created.

completedAt.description: The timestamp (in Unix time) when this message was completed, if applicable.

Agents.CodeInterpreterToolDefinition.description: A tool definition for the OpenAI Code Interpreter.

fileIds.description: A list of file IDs this code interpreter requires.

Agents.CompleteParams.description: Parameters for creating a new completion request.

agent.description: The agent responsible for generating the completion.

input.description: The list of input messages for the completion.

threadId.description: Optional identifier for an existing conversation thread.

metadata.description: Optional metadata associated with the completion request.

userId.description: Identifier for the user making the request.

store.description: Flag indicating whether to store the completion and associated messages.

Agents.CompletionUsage.description: Detailed token usage data for a completion request.

outputTokens.description: Number of completion tokens used over the course of the run step.

inputTokens.description: Number of prompt tokens used over the course of the run step.

totalTokens.description: Total number of tokens used (prompt + completion).

cachedTokens.description: The number of cached prompt tokens.

outputTokenDetails.description: Breakdown of tokens used in a completion.

reasoningTokens.description: Tokens generated by the model for reasoning.

Agents.CompletionsOptions.description: Represents advanced options for controlling agent completions.

truncationStrategy.description: Strategy for truncating messages when input exceeds model limits.

Agents.ContentFilterContent.description: A structured chat content item containing a content filter.

Agents.DeveloperMessage.description: A developer message within a chat, always with the 'developer' role.

content.description: The contents of the developer message.

Agents.FileContent.description: A structured chat content item containing a file data item.

fileName.description: The file name for this binary content.

mimeType.description: The MIME type for this binary content.

uri.description: URI where the binary content can be retrieved.

dataUri.description: Data URI containing the binary content inlined.

data.description: Raw bytes for the binary content.

Agents.FileSearchToolDefinition.description: A tool definition for the OpenAI File Search feature.

maxNumResults.description: The maximum number of search results to return (optional).

rankingOptions.description: Extra ranking options, including a threshold and a ranker.

ranker.description: The name of the ranker algorithm.

fileIds.description: A list of file IDs to be searched.

Agents.FunctionToolOptions.description: Options for a function-based tool behavior.

description.description: An optional description for the function-based tool.

parameters.description: A JSON schema describing the function's parameters.

strict.description: Indicates whether strict validation is required.

Agents.ImageContent.description: A structured chat content item containing an image reference.

width.description: Width of the image in pixels (optional).

height.description: Height of the image in pixels (optional).

fileName.description: The file name for this binary content.

mimeType.description: The MIME type for this binary content.

uri.description: URI where the binary content can be retrieved.

dataUri.description: Data URI containing the binary content inlined.

data.description: Raw bytes for the binary content.

Agents.JSONAny.description: A JSON-compatible type that can be a primitive, object, or array.

floatValue.description: A floating-point (double precision) value, if present.

nullValue.description: Indicates this represents a JSON null if set to true.

arrayValue.description: A JSON array, if present, expressed as an array of JSONAny elements.

objectValue.description: A JSON object, if present, expressed as a dictionary from string to JSONAny.

Agents.JSONSchema.description: Represents a JSON schema describing object properties and required fields.

properties.description: The properties defined in this JSON schema.

required.description: A list of required property names in this schema.

Agents.NoneToolChoiceBehavior.description: Behavior specifying that no tools may be chosen.

Agents.OpenAIAgentModel.description: A specialized AgentModel for OpenAI-based providers.

options.description: Provider-specific options for this OpenAI-based model.

Agents.OpenAIModelOptions.description: A set of provider-specific configuration and behavior options for OpenAI.

temperature.description:
The sampling temperature to use that controls the apparent creativity of generated completions.
Higher values will make output more random while lower values will make results more focused
and deterministic.
It is not recommended to modify temperature and topP for the same completions request as the
interaction of these two settings is difficult to predict.

topP.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature called nucleus sampling. This value causes the
model to consider the results of tokens with the provided probability mass. As an example, a
value of 0.15 will cause only the tokens comprising the top 15% of probability mass to be
considered.
It is not recommended to modify temperature and topP for the same completions request as the
interaction of these two settings is difficult to predict.

Agents.OpenApiToolDefinition.description: A tool definition for an OpenAI-based API described by an OpenAPI specification.

name.description: The name of the OpenAPI-based tool.

openApiSpec.description: A string containing the raw OpenAPI specification data.

Agents.RefusalContent.description: A structured chat content item containing model refusal information for a structured outputs request.

Agents.RequiredToolChoiceBehavior.description: Behavior specifying that the agent must always use the listed tools.

toolNames.description: The tool names that the agent must use.

Agents.StreamingAgentCompletionUpdate.description: A streaming update indicating incremental changes to an agent-generated completion.

messageId.description: Identifier of the message being updated.

authorName.description: Optional name of the message author.

authorRole.description: Role of the author for the updated message.

update.description: Optional content updates from the AI.

usage.description: Token usage information associated with this streaming update.

Agents.StreamingOperation.description: A streaming operation describing how to modify a partial response in real-time.

type.description: The type of operation being performed.

jsonPath.description: The JSON path to the operation.

value.description: The value to apply to the operation, expressed as a JSON-compatible type.

Agents.SystemMessage.description: A system message within a chat, always with the 'system' role.

content.description: The contents of the system message.

Agents.TextContent.description: A structured chat content item containing plain text.

annotations.description: A list of annotations in the text content.

Agents.Thread.description: Represents a chat thread, which can contain multiple messages.

threadId.description: A unique identifier for this thread.

messages.description: A list of messages in this thread.

Agents.ToolCallContent.description: A structured chat content item describing a tool call request.

name.description: The name of the tool to call.

toolCallId.description: The unique ID of the tool call.

arguments.description: Arguments passed to this tool call, expressed as JSON-like data rather than `unknown`.

Agents.ToolChoiceBehavior.description: The base behavior for how an agent chooses among available tools.

Agents.ToolMessage.description: A tool message within a chat, always with the 'tool' role.

content.description: The contents of the tool message.

Agents.ToolResultContent.description: A structured chat content item describing a tool result.

toolCallId.description: The ID of the tool call to which this result pertains.

results.description: The results returned from the tool, using JSONAny instead of `unknown`.

Agents.TruncationStrategy.description: Describes how to truncate messages if they exceed model or provider limits.

type.description: The type of truncation strategy to apply.

lastMessages.description: The number of most recent messages to retain when using 'lastMessages' strategy.

Agents.UserMessage.description: A user message within a chat, always with the 'user' role.

content.description: The contents of the user message.

Agents.VideoContent.description: A structured chat content item containing a video reference.

fileName.description: The file name for this binary content.

mimeType.description: The MIME type for this binary content.

uri.description: URI where the binary content can be retrieved.

dataUri.description: Data URI containing the binary content inlined.

data.description: Raw bytes for the binary content.

values.name: text
values.description: `text` format should be used for requests involving any sort of ToolCall.

values.name: jsonObject
values.description: Using `json_object` format will limit the usage of ToolCall to only functions.

AssistantsApiResponseFormat.description: An object describing the expected output of the model. If `json_object` only `function` type `tools` are allowed to be passed to the Run. If `text` the model can return text or any value needed.

values.name: text
values.description: `text` format should be used for requests involving any sort of ToolCall.

values.name: jsonObject
values.description: Using `json_object` format will limit the usage of ToolCall to only functions.

AssistantsApiResponseFormatMode.description: Represents the mode in which the model will handle the return format of a tool call.

values.name: auto
values.description: Default value. Let the model handle the return format.

values.name: none
values.description: Setting the value to `none`, will result in a 400 Bad request.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

Azure.Core.Foundations.InnerError.description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Microsoft One API guidelines - https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

connectionId.description: Connection id to Azure AI Search

indexName.description: Name of index in Azure AI Search resource to attach

type.description: Type of credential. Possible values are: AAD, SAS, ApiKey

BlobReferenceForConsumption.description: Represents a reference to a blob for consumption

blobUri.description: Blob URI path for client to upload data. Example: https://blob.windows.core.net/Container/Path

storageAccountArmId.description: ARM ID of the storage account to use.

credential.description: Credential info to access the storage account.

target.description: The connection URL to be used for this service

properties.description: A collection of properties of the connection

ConnectionType.description: The Type (or category) of the connection

values.name: APIKey
values.description: Generic connection that uses API Key authentication

DataPathAssetReference.description: Reference to an asset via its path in a datastore.

datastoreId.description: ARM resource ID of the datastore where the asset is located.

path.description: The path of the file/directory in the datastore.

DatasetType.description: Enum to determine the type of data.

isReference.description: Indicates if dataset is reference only or managed by dataset service. If true, the underlying data will be deleted when the dataset version is deleted

id.description: A unique identifier for the asset, assetId probably?

tags.description: Tag dictionary. Tags can be added, removed, and updated.

modelName.description: Publisher-specific name of the deployed model

modelVersion.description: Publisher-specific version of the deployed model

modelPublisher.description: Name of the deployed model's publisher

connectionName.description: Name of the connection the deployment comes from

displayName.description: Display Name for evaluation. It helps to find the evaluation easily in AI Foundry. It does not need to be unique.

description.description: Description of the evaluation. It can be used to store additional information about the evaluation and is mutable.

systemData.description: Metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

status.description: Status of the evaluation. It is set by service and is read-only.

tags.description: Evaluation's tags. Unlike properties, tags are fully mutable.

properties.description: Evaluation's properties. Unlike tags, properties are add-only. Once added, a property cannot be removed.

evaluators.description: Evaluators to be used for the evaluation.

ExtraParameters.description: Controls what happens if extra parameters, undefined by the REST API, are passed in the JSON request payload.

values.name: error
values.description: The service will error if it detected extra parameters in the request payload. This is the service default.

values.name: drop
values.description: The service will ignore (drop) extra parameters in the request payload. It will only pass the known parameters to the back-end AI model.

values.name: pass_through
values.description: The service will pass extra parameters to the back-end AI model.
